Class Notification

Notification Class

A class for sending email/message notifications to users. For now, only supports email recipients.

Namespace: UserFrosting
Package: UserFrosting
Author: Alex Weissman
Link: http://www.userfrosting.com/
Located at models/notify/Notification.php

Methods summary

public
# __construct( Twig_Template $template )

Create a new Notification instance.

Create a new Notification instance.

Parameters

$template
The Twig template object to use to create this notification.
public
# fromWebsite( string $reply_to_email = null, string $reply_to_name = null )

Set the sender of this notification as the website.

Set the sender of this notification as the website.

This uses the site setting "admin_email" as the "from" field, and "site_title" as the "from" name.

Parameters

$reply_to_email
The reply-to email address. Will default to the admin_email if not set.
$reply_to_name
The reply-to name. Will default to the site_title if not set.
public
# fromUser( UserFrosting\User $user )

Set the sender of this notification as a specific user

Set the sender of this notification as a specific user

For email, this uses the user's email as the "from" and "reply-to" emails, and the user's display_name as the "from" and "reply-to" names.

Parameters

$user
The user to send from.
public
# from( string $email, string $name = "", string $reply_to_email = null, string $reply_to_name = null )

Set the sender of this notification as an arbitary email address and name.

Set the sender of this notification as an arbitary email address and name.

This uses the site setting "admin_email" as the "from" field, and "site_title" as the "from" name.

Parameters

$email
The sender email address.
$name
The sender name.
$reply_to_email
The reply-to email address. Will default to $email if not set.
$reply_to_name
The reply-to name. Will default to $name if not set.
public UserFrosting\EmailRecipient
# addEmailRecipient( string $email, string $name = "", array $params = [] )

Add an email recipient.

Add an email recipient.

Each "recipient" added with this method will be sent out as a separate email. To CC or BCC recipients on the same email, use the ->cc and ->bcc methods on the EmailRecipient object returned by this method.

Parameters

$email
The primary recipient email address.
$name
The primary recipient name.
$params
An array of template parameters to render the email message with for this particular recipient.

Returns

UserFrosting\EmailRecipient
The EmailRecipient object created for this recipient, which you can call ->cc() or ->bcc() on to add CC and BCC.
public
# send( )

Send the notification.

Send the notification.

This method sends the notification to all recipients, rendering the template with the corresponding parameters for each recipient.

Throws

phpmailerException
The message could not be sent.
